markdown.markdown: **Choppell Maxwell**\ luvscandy27\@gmail.com\ 252-267-0787\ Suffolk, VA 23434 ------------------------------------------------------------------------ # Skills - Machine Learning\ - Predictive Modeling\ - SAS\ - SQL\ - R\ - Python\ - Tableau\ - Power BI\ - Excel\ - DataBricks - ICD-9 / ICD-10 Coding ------------------------------------------------------------------------ # Certifications - **SAS Certified Specialist**: Base Programming Using SAS 9.4 – SAS Institute (2020)\ - **COVID-19 Contact Tracing** – Johns Hopkins University (2020)\ - **Graduate Certificate in Analytics Using SAS** – Capella University (2019) ------------------------------------------------------------------------ # Education **Eastern University**\ *Master of Science in Data Science and Analytics* – *Expected July 2025* **Capella University**\ *Doctor of Public Health* – 2016 **Purdue University Global**\ *Master of Public Health* – 2012 **Elizabeth City State University**\ *Bachelor of Science* – 2002 ------------------------------------------------------------------------ # Work History ### **Centers for Disease Control and Prevention** – *Sr. Epidemiologist* Remote \| *Feb 2023 – Present*\ - Managed programmers and developers building a national Data Query System\ - Designed algorithms to transform large datasets into analytical models\ - Coded in SAS, R, and Python to clean and analyze public health data\ - Automated pipelines to improve processing time and efficiency\ - Led cross-functional innovation in epidemiological decision-making ------------------------------------------------------------------------ ### **Alexion/AstraZeneca Pharmaceuticals** – *Senior Epidemiologist Consultant* Remote \| *Feb 2021 – Feb 2023*\ - Led analytics for the PNH Registry and coordinated with biostats teams\ - Reviewed tables/figures and guided statistical analysis with SAS\ - Supported functions across Medical Affairs, Regulatory, and Clinical ------------------------------------------------------------------------ ### **Navy & Marine Corps Public Health Center (GDIT)** – *Senior Epidemiologist* Portsmouth, VA \| *Apr 2019 – Feb 2021*\ - Oversaw military claims data from MDR for 9.2M beneficiaries\ - Conducted broad-spectrum analyses of military/non-military facilities ------------------------------------------------------------------------ ### **CDC (CTE Contractor)** – *Epidemiologist* Atlanta, GA \| *Oct 2016 – Apr 2019*\ - Led analysis of immunization and exemption data\ - Built models to track vaccination coverage and inform policy ------------------------------------------------------------------------ ### **Ameritox** – *Certifying Scientist* Greensboro, NC \| *Jun 2010 – Nov 2016*\ - Conducted drug testing and analysis on opioid misuse\ - Advised physicians on chronic pain medication compliance ------------------------------------------------------------------------ # Publications - *The Integration of Mental Health Services into Routine Check-Ups for Women of Childbearing Potential* (2016)\ - *Vaccination Coverage and Exemption Rates Among Kindergartners in the U.S.* (CDC, 2018)
